data.question: What is the journal title where the research article was published?
data.answer: Journal of the American Chemical Society

data.question: Who is the corresponding author of the research article?
What is the main focus of the research article?
data.answer: A well-defined pincer-Rh catalyst for C–S cross-coupling reactions

data.question: What is the catalyst used for coupling of aryl chlorides and bromides with thiols?
What is the yield of the coupling product when using p-BrC6H4CF3 with cyclohexanethiol under the described conditions?
What is the effect of excess aryl halide on the catalysis rate?
data.answer: The presence of 10 equivalents of aryl halide does not significantly affect the yield compared to 1.1 equivalents.

data.question: Is the formation of Ar–H a side product in the catalytic reactions?
Does the catalyst resting state involve the complex (POCOP)Rh(SPh2)?
What is the role of NaOtBu in the reaction mechanism?
data.answer: NaOtBu serves to dehydrochlorinate the precatalyst and produce the catalytically relevant three-coordinate (pincer)Rh intermediate.

data.question: What is the impact of ortho-substitution on the rate of catalysis?
data.answer: Ortho-substitution in the aryl halide significantly slows down both the reductive elimination and oxidative addition steps, potentially reducing the overall rate of catalysis.

data.question: Can (POCOP)Rh(SPh2) react directly with NaSPh to form (POCOP)Rh(NaSPh)?
What is the turnover number (TON) for the coupling of p-BrC6H4F with cyclohexanethiol using 0.1% catalyst loading?
Does increasing the steric bulk of the thiolate ligand always slow down the rate of catalysis?
What is the effect of adding excess thioether product to the catalytic reaction?
data.answer: Adding excess thioether product inhibits the coupling of cyclohexanethiol with p-FC6H4Cl but not with p-FC6H4Br.

data.question: What is the publication year of the research article?
